RYAN LUU'S ACTIVITY SHEET

A daily productivity journal → About Me

  • New personal site navigartion

     Mar 5, 2017

    The sidebar menu that I had for my personal site didn't fit with the redesign I've been working on, so I rebuilt it and made it mobile friendly.

    I also added a smooth scrolling animation for clicking to scroll to anchor tags.

  • Mobile Login Switch

     Mar 4, 2017

    Stash's mobile experience is getting some updates and one thing that we noticed was that the having the login/signup switch at the bottom of the form for mobile is hidden and inconvenient. I refactored the trigger for mobile to allow users to switch between login/signup at the top of the registraion block.

  • http vs https

     Mar 3, 2017

    We added a ssl certificate to Stash today to secure the site, which is especially important now that we have users logging in to use the product.

    However, the new https security created a pretty significant issue for embedding webpages. Any webpage that is not secure (http) will not embed inside of a secure (https) site because it poses a sercurity risk.

    That's extremely unfortunate and we're looking into solutions such as setting up proxy calls for http sites through https connections as well as doubling down on screenshotting webpages for sites that don't embed.

  • Stash case study

     Mar 2, 2017

    I finished my case study for Stash!

    Check it out here.

  • Colorful homepage

     Mar 1, 2017

    My personal site is coming together, but the project intros on the homepage were really bland. I decided to use the brand colors as the intro backgrounds to add some personality.

    I like how they pop on the page and catch attention as you scroll.
